(smaller eastern part). It's a popular summer sea resort for people from Eastern Germany and Poland.

value: the only Polish city on this island.

Standard Hochdeutsch is spoken throughout the German portion of the island. Traditional Low German dialects are still alive as well. Both Polish and some German are spoken on the Polish side.
Usedom ist well connected for travellers througout the year. The Usedomer Bäderbahn
. Bridges connect the island via the federal streest Züstrin (B 110) and in Wolgast (B111).
has a small airport that connects cities as far away as
during the summer. The airport is connected by bus to the beaches.
A guided "Island Safari" tour by 4WD vehicle is available from
which is a locally run company that can tailor routes to specific needs and will take you to the most beautiful parts of the island.
